nodes.description: Al-Shabaab attackers disguised as security soldiers stormed the Ministry of Interior headquarters in Mogadishu after detonating a car bomb at the gate.
At least 20 people, including staff members of the two ministries, were killed in the attack while dozens sustained wounds.
The Somali government arrested 14 security officials over the attack following a security meeting in the capital.
The detained officers were in charge of the checkpoints near the attacked compound and were taken into custody for inquiry.
The security minister and police and intelligence chiefs attended a security meeting in the capital on Sunday regarding the attack.
Al-Shabaab attackers used ministry of security identity cards to pass through the security checkpoints and gain access to the building.
The spokesman of the ministry of security believed Al-Shabaab could not carry out the attack without internal help from Somali security agencies.
